result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R Nieuwenhuis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Jason R Nieuwenhuis was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason R Nieuwenhuis is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Jason R Nieuwenhuis was found guilty of Fail/Obtain Deer Hunting License, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.024(1).
  • Jason R Nieuwenhuis was found guilty of Hunt/Fish/Trap After Revocation (2nd+ w/in 5 yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.967(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:59 am 
BAILIFF OPENS COURT. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt; Deft appears in person with Atty Keith Ellison. 
Jury Panel is present. Jury Panel sworn. 
COURT reads statement of the case. 
Counsel introduce themselves and their possible witnesses. 
10:03 am - Voir Dire by the Court. 
10:05 am - Voir Dire by the State. 
10:34 am - Voir Dire by Atty Ellison. 
10:56 am - COURT thanks and excuses jurors seated behind the rail. Parties make their strikes. 
11:08 am - COURT reads Jurors selected. COURT thanks and excuses those not selected. 
11:10 am - Selected Jury Panel sworn. COURT reads preliminary jury instructions. 
11:15 am - Jury exits to make phone calls. COURT places sidebars on the record. 
11:19 am - COURT recesses. 
11:37 am - COURT and jury reconvenes. COURT instructs jury further. 
11:38 am - State makes Opening Statements. 
11:45 am - Atty Ellison makes Opening Statements. 
12:00 pm - Jury recesses. COURT places sidebar on the record. 
12:03 pm - COURT recesses. 
1:07 pm - COURT and Jury reconvene. M.B. sworn and testifies. 
1:59 pm - D.N. sworn and testifies. 
2:41 pm - Jury recesses. COURT notes proposed jury instructions/verdict forms given to counsel. 
2:43 pm - COURT recesses. 
3:02 pm - COURT and Jury reconvene. Warden Randy Dunkel sworn and testifies. 
4:20 pm - State rests. Jury recesses. COURT places sidebar on the record. Atty Ellison moves for mistrial. Argument. COURT denies motion for mistrial. COURT places other sidebar on the record. 
4:31 pm - COURT recesses. 
4:39 pm - COURT reconvenes. COURT questions deft re: testifying. Deft elects to not testify. COURT finds deft made decision not to testify knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily. COURT holds instructions conference on the record. 
4:53 pm - COURT recesses. 
4:58 pm - COURT reconvenes. COURT notes Ct. 3 is to be decided by the Court. State proceeds with testimony re: Ct. 3 - Jury is NOT present. B.B. sworn and testifies. 
5:11 pm - Jury reconvenes. COURT instructs the jury. 
5:26 pm - Closing Arguments by the State. 
5:41 pm - Closing Arguments by Atty Ellison. 
5:53 pm - Rebuttal Closing Arguments by the State. 
5:55 pm - COURT further instructs the jury. 
5:59 pm - Bailiffs sworn. Jury exits to deliberate. COURT notes sidebar on the record. 
6:02 pm - COURT recesses. 
6:22 pm - COURT reconvenes. Jury is NOT present. 
State rests re: Ct. 3. 
D.N. recalled for testimony re: Ct. 3. 
COURT makes findings - as to:
 Ct. 3 (Trespass to Land)>>NOT GUILTY by COURT. 
6:34 pm - Jury reconvenes. Jury has reached a verdict. 
COURT reads verdict - as to: 
Ct. 1 (Fail/Obtain Deer Hunting License)>>GUILTY 
and as to: 
Ct. 2 (Hunt/Fish/Trap After Revocation (2nd+ within 5 yrs))>>GUILTY. 
COURT polls the jury. 
6:37 pm - COURT reads final jury instructions. COURT thanks and excuses the jury. 
State moves for entry of judgment on the verdicts. 
COURT enters judgment of convictions on Cts. 1 & 2 based upon the verdicts of the Jury. 
Argument as to sentencing. 
COURT ORDERS: 
On Ct. 1>>$1500 plus costs; 3 year revocation of all chapter 29 privileges and approvals. 
On Ct. 2>>$500 plus costs. 
COURT gives deft 60 days to pay fine or payment plan. 
COURT does NOT order DNA sample/surcharge due to the date of the offense. 
Atty Ellison requests trail camera be returned. 
COURT ORDERS trail camera returned. 
Adj: 6:59 pm 

Clerk amends minutes on 1/19/2017 at 8:09 am

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 8:32 am 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt; Deft appears in person with Atty Keith Ellison. 
Date and time set for hearing prior to commencing with Jury Trial. 
COURT notes 3 motions filed recently by Atty Ellison. 

MOTION TO SEVER CIVIL CASE. 
Atty Ellison makes statement. 
COURT notes intent to only proceed on 2 criminal matters with Jury Trial. 
State notes witness to the trespass will NOT testify in front of the jury. 

MOTION IN LIMINE: EXCLUDING INFORMATION RE: HUNTING IN 2013 WITHOUT CAMCORDER. 
State makes statement and has NO objection to motion. 
COURT grants. 

MOTION TO DISMISS. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling - denies motion to dismiss. 

Parties address jury instruction re: Ct. 2. 
COURT questions Atty Ellison/deft re: stipulating to 4th element. 
Deft stipulates to 4th element. 
COURT accepts stipulation and finds stipulation made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently. 

State provides deft with final settlement offer. 
COURT questions deft re: State's final offer. 
OTR: 9:05 am BOTR: 9:42 am

State notes additional MIL filed by defense on 8/23/2016. 
Parties discuss those MIL. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives rulings as needed. 

COURT questions deft re: State's final offer. 
Deft wishes to proceed to trial. 

State requests sequestration as stated on the record. 
COURT grants sequestration with 1 exception as stated. 

Atty Ellison notes MIL re: prior convictions as agreed upon by the parties

Adj: 9:48 am
